change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 55/2006, effective March 28, 2006.

reg.title: Advertising, Deposits, Disposition and Extensions Regulation
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 146/2005, March 18, 2005]

subsection.subsectiontext: In this regulation:

definition.def: means a forest licence, timber sale licence, timber licence, tree farm licence, woodlot licence, forestry licence to cut or Christmas tree permit;
means a person who enters into an agreement, other than a Christmas tree permit, with the government;
means a person who enters into a Christmas tree permit with the government.

subsection.subsectiontext: In section 58.3 of the Act and this regulation, harvesting means to

paragraph.paragraphtext: cut,
remove, or
knock down

section.defsandwich: any timber authorized for harvest under a timber sale licence.

section.marginalnote: Timber sale licence and forest licence
section.sectiontext: An advertisement inviting applications for a forest licence or a timber sale licence must,

paragraph.paragraphtext: if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the total volume of timber to be authorized for harvesting under the licence is less than 2 000 m3, or
the timber must be removed expeditiously because it is in imminent danger of being damaged, destroyed or otherwise lost,

section.parasandwich: be published at least once, a minimum of 5 days before the date of sale, in at least one newspaper circulating in or near the area proposed for the licence,

paragraph.paragraphtext: if the total volume of timber to be authorized for harvesting under the licence is 2 000 m3 or more, but less than 15 000 m3, be published

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in at least one issue of the Gazette, and
at least once, within a period of 3 consecutive weeks following the date of the publication in the Gazette, in at least one newspaper circulating in or near the area proposed for the licence,

paragraph.paragraphtext: if the total volume of timber to be authorized for harvesting under the licence is 15 000 m3 or more, but less than 100 000 m3, be published

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in at least one issue of the Gazette, and

at least once every 2 weeks, within a period of 4 consecutive weeks following the date of publication in the Gazette, in at least one newspaper circulating in or near the area proposed for the licence, or

paragraph.paragraphtext: if the total volume of timber to be authorized for harvesting under the licence is 100 000 m3 or more, be published

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in at least one issue of the Gazette, and

at least once every 2 weeks, within a period of 8 consecutive weeks following the date of the publication in the Gazette, in at least one newspaper circulating in or near the area proposed for the licence.

section.sectiontext: An advertisement inviting applications for a tree farm licence

paragraph.paragraphtext: must be published

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in at least one issue of the Gazette, and

in at least one newspaper circulating in or near the area proposed for the licence with at least one advertisement in every second week within the period of 8 consecutive weeks from the date of the publication in the Gazette,

paragraph.paragraphtext: must be broadcast at least once every second week within a period of 8 consecutive weeks on a radio or television station received in or near the area proposed for the licence, and
must include

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: an informal description of the land proposed for the licence,
the place and a date, at least 4 months following the publication in the Gazette for the public hearing referred to in section 33 (2) of the Act, and
a name of a place in the forest region where persons are able to obtain details of the proposed licence.

section.sectiontext: An advertisement inviting applications for a probationary community forest agreement

paragraph.paragraphtext: must be published

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in at least one issue of the Gazette, and

in at least one newspaper circulating in or near the area proposed for the agreement, at least once every 2 weeks within a period of 4 consecutive weeks following the date of the publication in the Gazette, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: must include

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: an informal description of

clause.clausetext: the land that is proposed for the community forest agreement, or
the geographic area where any proposed agreement area will be located, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the name of a place in the forest region or forest district where persons can obtain details of the proposed agreement.

section.sectiontext: An advertisement inviting applications for a community salvage licence

paragraph.paragraphtext: must be published

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in at least one issue of the Gazette, and

in at least one newspaper circulating in or near the area proposed for the agreement, at least once every 2 weeks within a period of 4 consecutive weeks following the date of the publication in the Gazette, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: must include

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: an informal description of the land proposed for the licence, and
the name of a place in the forest region or forest district where persons can obtain details of the proposed licence.

section.sectiontext: An advertisement inviting applications for a woodlot licence

paragraph.paragraphtext: must be published

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in at least one issue of the Gazette, and

in at least one newspaper circulating in or near the area proposed for the licence, at least once every 2 weeks within a period of 4 consecutive weeks following the date of publication in the Gazette, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: must include

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: an informal description of the land proposed for the licence, and
the name of a place in the forest region or forest district where persons can obtain details of the proposed licence.

section.marginalnote: Publication of offer or intent to offer replacement licence

subsection.subsectiontext: Notice of

paragraph.paragraphtext: an offer of a forest licence made under section 15 (1.1) or (1.2) or an intent to offer a forest licence under section 15 (1.1),
an offer of a timber licence made under section 28 (2),
an offer of a tree farm licence made under section 36 (1.1) or (1.2) or an intent to offer a tree farm licence under section 36 (1.1), or
an offer of a woodlot licence made under section 46 (1)

section.subsandwich: of the Act must be published in the Gazette and in at least one issue of at least one newspaper circulating in or near the area of the licence not later than 6 weeks after the offer or intent to offer, as the case may be, is made.

subsection.subsectiontext: A notice published under subsection (1) must

paragraph.paragraphtext: identify the person to whom the offer or intent to offer was made,
describe informally the land and timber that is subject to the licence offered or intended to be offered, and
describe the term of the licence offered or intended to be offered.

subsection.subsectiontext: If, under Part 3 of the Act, an application is made for an agreement, other than a Christmas tree permit, the application must include

paragraph.paragraphtext: in cash or by certified cheque an amount that equals one year's rent for the agreement as calculated according to the Act, and

in cash, by certified cheque or by other security acceptable to the minister, a deposit that equals the amount calculated under section 7, according to the information available at the time of the application.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsection (1), if an application is made for an agreement in the form of a timber sale licence to which section 7 (1) (c) (i) applies, the application may be without a deposit or may include part or all of the deposit amount required under subsection (1) (b) of this section, as specified by the timber sales manager.

The successful applicant for a timber sale licence to which section 7 (1) (c) (ii) applies must pay, on demand, before entering into the agreement, any amount by which the deposit calculated under section 7 (1) (c) (ii) exceeds the amount of deposit paid under subsection (1) or (2).

If all or part of the deposit is used by the government during the term of a timber sale licence, the successful applicant must, on demand, make a further payment to maintain the deposit in the amount determined by this section.
If

paragraph.paragraphtext: an offer of a replacement for an agreement, other than a Christmas tree permit, or
an agreement, other than a Christmas tree permit, is surrendered for replacement,

section.subsandwich: the person who accepts the offer or surrenders the agreement

paragraph.paragraphtext: must maintain on deposit with the government an amount equal to one year's rent for the replacement agreement plus a deposit for that agreement calculated in accordance with section 7, and

if the amounts required to be maintained on deposit by paragraph (c) exceed the like amounts on deposit with the government in respect of the agreement being replaced, must pay the government the difference on demand.

subsection.subsectiontext: An application for an agreement or for an offer or surrender of an agreement, other than a Christmas tree permit, that relates to

paragraph.paragraphtext: the construction or operation of a timber processing facility or other improvement, or
land on which is situated the personal property owned by a person other than the applicant or a person accepting the offer or surrendering the agreement or the government

section.subsandwich: must include in cash, by certified cheque or by other security acceptable to the minister a deposit that equals the amount specified in the invitation for application or the offer or surrender, as the case may be.

subsection.subsectiontext: The deposit referred to in section 6 (1) to (5) is

paragraph.paragraphtext: for a tree farm licence, 10¢/m3 of the allowable annual cut,
for a timber sale licence entered into under section 24 (2) of the Act before its repeal, 20¢/m3 of the allowable annual cut,
for a timber sale licence, other than a timber sale licence referred to in paragraph (b), an amount determined by the timber sales manager that is

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: for the purpose of section 6 (1) (b), and subject to section 6 (2), is not less than the greater of

clause.clausetext: 2% of the total estimated upset stumpage value, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: for the purpose of section 6 (3) is not less than the sum of 10% of the first $100 000 of total estimated stumpage value plus 5% of the remaining total estimated stumpage value,

paragraph.paragraphtext: for a forest licence, 15¢/m3 of the allowable annual cut,
for a community salvage licence, $1 500,
for a woodlot licence, $200,
for a forestry licence to cut entered into under

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: section 24.8 or 24.9 of the Act, 20¢/m3 of the total licence volume,
section 47.3 of the Act, 20¢/m3 of the total licence volume,

section 47.6 (2) of the Act, an amount determined by the regional manager or district manager that is the sum of 10% of the first $100 000 of the total estimated stumpage value plus 5% of the remaining total estimated stumpage value, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: for a forestry licence to cut entered into under

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: section 47.6 (3) of the Act, an amount determined by the timber sales manager, and
section 47.6 (4) of the Act, an amount determined by the regional manager or district manager.

subsection.subsectiontext: If under subsection (1) (g) (iii) the minimum amount of deposit is less than $500, the deposit required must be

paragraph.paragraphtext: zero, or

section.subsandwich: as determined by the regional manager or the district manager.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsections (1) and (2), section 7 of the Advertising, Deposits and Disposition Regulation, B.C. Reg. 552/78, as it read immediately before November 4, 2003, applies to a timber sale licence that was advertised or entered into before that date.

section.marginalnote: Refund if application not approved or if conditionally approved
section.sectiontext: If an application for an agreement is not approved or is approved subject to a condition, the money paid under section 6 in respect of the application may be refunded, if the regional manager, timber sales manager or district manager is satisfied that there is no need for a deposit.

section.marginalnote: Forfeiture of deposit for failure to enter agreement

subsection.subsectiontext: If an application for an agreement is approved or conditionally approved but the applicant does not enter into the agreement, the money paid under section 6 in respect of the application is forfeited to the government.

At the request of an applicant who did not enter into an agreement, the minister or person authorized by the minister may relieve the applicant from the forfeiture imposed under subsection (1) if the minister or person authorized by the minister is satisfied that the applicant did not enter into the agreement as the result of

paragraph.paragraphtext: an event that

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: is not related to financial circumstances of the applicant,
is beyond the control of the applicant, and
would, if the agreement were entered into, prevent the agreement obligations from being carried out, or

paragraph.paragraphtext: a mistake made by the government which would make the agreement voidable.

subsection.subsectiontext: A request referred to in subsection (2) must

paragraph.paragraphtext: be submitted within 30 days after the date the person is notified that their deposit has been forfeited under subsection (1),
be signed by, or on behalf of, the requesting person, and
specify the reasons for the request.

section.sectiontext: In sections 11 to 13, agreement does not include a BC timber sales agreement.

section.marginalnote: Refund if obligations fulfilled or substantially fulfilled

subsection.subsectiontext: A deposit paid under this regulation in respect of an agreement may be refunded,

paragraph.paragraphtext: in full, if the regional manager or district manager is satisfied that the licensee has fulfilled its obligations under or in respect of the agreement, or
in part, if the regional manager or district manager is satisfied that the licensee has substantially fulfilled its obligations under or in respect of the agreement.

subsection.subsectiontext: A deposit paid under this regulation in respect of a BC timber sales agreement may be refunded

paragraph.paragraphtext: in full, if the timber sales manager is satisfied that the licensee has fulfilled its obligations under or in respect of the agreement, or
in an amount not exceeding 75% of the original deposit, if the timber sales manager is satisfied that the licensee has substantially fulfilled its obligations under or in respect of the agreement.

subsection.subsectiontext: The regional manager or district manager must realize a licensee's deposit if satisfied that the licensee did not comply with the terms and conditions of an agreement and the agreement

paragraph.paragraphtext: is cancelled, or
expires.

subsection.subsectiontext: The regional manager or district manager must dispose of the amount realized from the deposit, first, under the terms of the agreement, and then as to any amount remaining,

paragraph.paragraphtext: 50% of the original deposit, or all of the balance remaining if the balance is less than 50%, to the government, and

the remainder to the licensee, unless the regional manager or district manager is satisfied that some or all of the remainder should be retained by the government after consideration of the following:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: whether the licensee owes money to the government that may be set-off under the Financial Administration Act;
an estimate of the direct and indirect costs to the government resulting from the licensee's non-compliance with the terms and conditions of the agreement including, without restriction,

clause.clausetext: costs incurred or that will be incurred by the government in the ordinary course of business as a result of the non-compliance;

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: any other information that the regional manager or district manager considers to be relevant.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsections (1) and (2), the minister or the minister's delegate may waive the requirement to realize a deposit under this section or may realize a different amount than determined under subsection (2) if satisfied that the non-compliance was the result of an event that

paragraph.paragraphtext: is not related to financial circumstances of the licensee,
is beyond the control of the licensee, and
prevents the licence obligations from being carried out.

section.marginalnote: Forfeiture of deposit for non-compliance respecting BC timber sales agreement

subsection.subsectiontext: The timber sales manager must realize a BC timber sales agreement deposit if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the timber sales manager is satisfied that its holder did not comply with

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the terms and conditions of an agreement,
the Act or a regulation made under the Act, or
the Forest and Range Practices Act or a regulation or standard made under that Act, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the agreement

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: is cancelled,
expires, or
has expired and the holder has not remedied the non-compliance by a date, not exceeding 2 years from the date of expiry, specified by the timber sales manager.

subsection.subsectiontext: The amount realized from the deposit under subsection (1) must be disposed of as follows:

paragraph.paragraphtext: first, if the timber sales manager considers it to be necessary or desirable, for the purposes of remedying an outstanding obligation

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in respect of the agreement, or
in respect of the agreement that is related to

clause.clausetext: the Act or a regulation made under the Act, or
the Forest and Range Practices Act or a regulation or standard made under that Act;

paragraph.paragraphtext: then, as to any amount remaining,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: 50% of the original deposit, or all of the balance remaining if the balance is less than 50%, to the government, and

the remainder to the holder of the BC timber sales agreement, unless the timber sales manager is satisfied that some or all of the remainder should be retained by the government after consideration of the following:

clause.clausetext: whether the holder owes money to the government that may be set-off under the Financial Administration Act;
an estimate of the direct and indirect costs to the government resulting from the holder's non-compliance with the terms and conditions of the agreement including, without restriction,

subclause.subclausetext: costs incurred or that will be incurred by the government in the ordinary course of business as a result of the non-compliance;

clause.clausetext: any other information that the timber sales manager considers to be relevant.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsection (2), if the timber sales manager is satisfied that the holder has substantially fulfilled its obligations under or in respect of a BC timber sales agreement, the timber sales manager must dispose of the amount realized from a deposit as follows:

paragraph.paragraphtext: first, if the timber sales manager considers it to be necessary or desirable, for the purposes of remedying an outstanding obligation

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in respect of the agreement, or
in respect of the agreement that is related to

clause.clausetext: the Act or a regulation made under the Act, or
the Forest and Range Practices Act or a regulation or standard made under that Act;

paragraph.paragraphtext: then, as to any amount remaining,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: 25% of the original deposit, or all of the balance remaining if the balance is less than 25%, to the government, and
the remainder to the holder unless the holder owes money to the government that may be set-off under the Financial Administration Act.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsections (1) to (3), a deposit paid under this regulation in respect of a BC timber sales agreement is forfeited to the government if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the deposit is for a timber sale licence,
the licence is cancelled or expires, and
no harvesting has taken place under the licence.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsections (1) to (4), and at the request of the holder referred to in subsections (1) to (4), the minister or the minister's delegate may relieve the holder from

paragraph.paragraphtext: the realization of a deposit under subsection (1), or
a forfeiture under subsection (4)

section.subsandwich: if satisfied that the non-compliance or failure to harvest was the result of an event that

paragraph.paragraphtext: is not related to financial circumstances of the holder,
is beyond the control of the holder, and
prevents the agreement obligations from being carried out or prevents the harvesting being carried out.

subsection.subsectiontext: A request referred to in subsection (5) must

paragraph.paragraphtext: be submitted within 30 days after the date the holder is advised that all or a portion of the holder's deposit has been realized under subsection (1) or (4),
be signed by, or on behalf of, the requesting person, and
specify the reasons for the request.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subsections (1) to (3) do not apply to a timber sale licence that was advertised before July 5, 2002

paragraph.paragraphtext: under section 20 of the Act, or section 21 of the Act before its repeal, and
for which, under those sections, applications were restricted to one or more categories of small business forest enterprises.

subsection.subsectiontext: An application to extend the term of a timber sale licence must be in a form required by the timber sales manager.
Before an application to extend a timber sale licence is approved, the applicant is required to pay the government a fee equal to 5% of the amount calculated under section 58.1 (5) of the Act.
An application to extend the term of a cutting permit must be in a form required by the district manager.
Before an extension of a cutting permit is approved, the application is required to pay to the government a fee equal to the amount calculated according to the following formula:

tablerow.tablecol:
the total stumpage rate
in effect at time of
cutting permit issuance

the total net cruise volume at the time of cutting permit
issuance or, in the absence of the total net cruise volume,
an estimation of the total volume

content.regnote: Note: this regulation replaces B.C. Reg. 552/78.
content.provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Forest Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 157, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: sections 151 (1) and (2) (e)]
